Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = state in which humans are willing to listen to other humans
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: to put (one's) hand on (one's) mouth; hence: = action by which humans intentionally refrain from speaking
literally: to lay (one's) hand on (one's) mouth; hence: = action by which humans purposefully refrain from speaking up
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

Node.gloss: to be in anguish|to be dismayed
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such trembling and pain

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

Node.gloss: to grow old|to reach old age
Node.definition: = process by which humans become advanced in age; ≈ seen as a reward for righteous behavior

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

Node.gloss: to become powerful|to grow mighty|to prevail
Node.definition: = process by which humans gain strength, power, and authority, which enables them to do things that others are unable to accomplish

= state in which a human being, animal, or deity is deemed worthy of respect because of characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal
literally: to be established; hence: = process by which humans find security and stability
= one's children including their respective offspring ◄ literally referred to as those who come forth from someone

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
literally: stick, rod; hence: = process of causing systematic suffering to someone else ◄ as if one were beating someone else with a rod
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which a male animal is unable to impregnate a female
= female bovine; ► clean animal
literally: to send out (one's young); hence: = process by which animals give birth

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood
= action with which humans or animals move in a quick and light or lively way
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words

= musical instrument, consisting of a membrane, usually of animal skin, which was stretched over a shallow circular, triangular, or square frame; ► it was struck sharply with one or two hands, depending on where it was situated; it could be held in one hand, under the arm, or against the chest and struck with the other hand, or it could be held on the knees or the ground and struck with one or two hands; the fingers of one hand could be used to tighten or loosen the tension on the membrane as it was struck

= musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= wood wind instrument; ≈ its music is associated with joy and well being
literally: to finish (one's) days; hence: = action by which people go through the motions of life for a particular amount of time
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which humans with an agitated and fearful mind have found new confidence

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= process by which someone's well being is promoted by a certain action or event
= action by which humans address deities with humility and politeness, ► with the purpose of asking for a favor
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)
literally: goodness; = state in which people go through a time of relative prosperity

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= small container ◄ made out of earthenware, ► filled with oil (שֶׁמֶן) and with a wick (פִּשְׁתָּה) placed in it; sometimes placed on a lampstand (מְנֹורָה) used as a source of light (אֹור) ≈ associated with peace, stability and well being
= process by which a fire or light is put out; ≈ associated with the beginning of difficult times, and sometimes even death
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
= experience of having painful contractions of the womb; ◄ caused by advanced state of pregnancy; ► and resulting in the birth of new offspring; ≈ associated with fear and agony
= causative action by which deities cause events to undergo a particular state or event
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= dried stalks of grain and grasses, usually left over from harvesting grain ► used as food for animals or as an ingredient for making clay bricks; ≈ associated with something of little value

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped

= action by which humans secretly take possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even of other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to store up events in one's mind; hence: = action by which deities keep a record of events ► in order to act upon them at a later date
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which humans are suffering caused by difficult circumstances; ≈ often seen as the consequences of their own wickedness
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
meaning unsure; possibly: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed
= the quantity of a number of objects or the frequency of a number of events
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= action by which someone determines an amount of time for humans to perform an event
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

literally: to be, become high; hence: = processs by which humans or deities acquire an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

= a marker drawing the reader's attention to the object or event directly following it and identifying it with emphasis as the object or event in focus, as opposed to other, similar objects and events
meaning unsure: = part of the human body, possibly the side or the thigh; ≈ used metonymically to refer to the entire body
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

= white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex
= a soft fatty substance in the cavities of bones; ≈ associated with health and vigor
= any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: bitter; hence: = state in which humans are in deep distress

Node.gloss: to eat > to enjoy|to eat > to use up
Node.definition: literally: to eat (goods); hence = pattern of actions by which someone makes a living off material goods until they are gone; ≈ often associated with joy
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

= small, soft, legless, tube shaped creatures that have no bones or shells; they typically feed on overripe fruit, rotting meat, and similar things; most are larvae that hatch from the eggs laid by flies or some beetles; associated with uncleanness, mortality, decay, and death
literally: to cover; hence: = state in which objects are present in a very great quantity
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense
= action by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans with which they have a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich themselves in one way or another

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= object or event that reminds of something that has happened or as a confirmation of something that is yet to happen
= action by which humans or deities show a favorable attitude to (other) humans

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
= causative action by which humans or deities keep (other) humans from performing a particular event
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another
= a place where dead people are buried
= state in which an event is pleasant
= lump of earth or clay
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which humans move as a group from one location to another

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: there is no counting (of it); hence: = state in which objects cannot be counted or measured because of their abundance

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
